com.eyetechds.quicklink

Class QLColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eyetechds.quicklink.QLLong
      • com.eyetechds.quicklink.QLColor

  • public class QLColor
extends QLLong
    The Class QLColor defines a Color object for use in QuickLink.
    See Also:
    QLDevice.setIndicator(QLIndicatorType, QLIndicatorMode, QLColor), QLDevice.getIndicator(QLIndicatorType, QLIndicatorMode, QLColor)

    • Constructor Detail

      • QLColor

        public QLColor()
        Constructs a new QLColor object with an initial value of zero. Equivalent to calling:

        QLColor(0, 0, 0, 0)

      • QLColor

        public QLColor(long red,
       long green,
       long blue,
       long intensity)
        Constructs a new QLColor object. The initial value comes from the input color values.
        Parameters:
        red - The red portion of the initial value. Range (0 - 255).
        green - The green portion of the initial value. Range (0 - 255).
        blue - The blue portion of the initial value. Range (0 - 255).
        intensity - The intensity portion of the initial value. Range (0 - 255).

      • QLColor

        public QLColor(QLColor source)
        Constructs a new QLColor object. The initial value comes from the source object.
        Parameters:
        source - The source for the initial value of this object.

        Set the value of this object.
        Parameters:

        green - The green portion of the new color. Range (0 - 255).
        blue - The blue portion of the new color. Range (0 - 255).
        intensity - The intensity portion of the new color. Range (0 - 255).
